001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of
003// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.
004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.MetersPerSecond;
008import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Volts;
009import static edu.wpi.first.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
010
011import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.PIDController;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.RamseteController;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.SimpleMotorFeedforward;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.ChassisSpeeds;
016import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.DifferentialDriveKinematics;
017import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds;
018import edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.Trajectory;
019import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.MutLinearVelocity;
020import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
021import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer;
022import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
023import java.util.function.Supplier;
024
025/**
026 * A command that uses a RAMSETE controller ({@link RamseteController}) to follow a trajectory
027 * {@link Trajectory} with a differential drive.
028 *
029 * <p>The command handles trajectory-following, PID calculations, and feedforwards internally. This
030 * is intended to be a more-or-less "complete solution" that can be used by teams without a great
031 * deal of controls expertise.
032 *
033 * <p>Advanced teams seeking more flexibility (for example, those who wish to use the onboard PID
034 * functionality of a "smart" motor controller) may use the secondary constructor that omits the PID
035 * and feedforward functionality, returning only the raw wheel speeds from the RAMSETE controller.
036 *
037 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
038 */
039public class RamseteCommand extends Command {
040  private final Timer m_timer = new Timer();
041  private final boolean m_usePID;
042  private final Trajectory m_trajectory;
043  private final Supplier<Pose2d> m_pose;
044  private final RamseteController m_follower;
045  private final SimpleMotorFeedforward m_feedforward;
046  private final DifferentialDriveKinematics m_kinematics;
047  private final Supplier<DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds> m_speeds;
048  private final PIDController m_leftController;
049  private final PIDController m_rightController;
050  private final BiConsumer<Double, Double> m_output;
051  private DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds m_prevSpeeds = new DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds();
052  private final MutLinearVelocity m_prevLeftSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
053  private final MutLinearVelocity m_prevRightSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
054  private final MutLinearVelocity m_leftSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
055  private final MutLinearVelocity m_rightSpeedSetpoint = MetersPerSecond.mutable(0);
056  private double m_prevTime;
057
058  /**
059   * Constructs a new RamseteCommand that, when executed, will follow the provided trajectory. PID
060   * control and feedforward are handled internally, and outputs are scaled -12 to 12 representing
061   * units of volts.
062   *
063   * <p>Note: The controller will *not* set the outputVolts to zero upon completion of the path -
064   * this is left to the user, since it is not appropriate for paths with nonstationary endstates.
065   *
066   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
067   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
068   *     provide this.
069   * @param controller The RAMSETE controller used to follow the trajectory.
070   * @param feedforward The feedforward to use for the drive.
071   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
072   * @param wheelSpeeds A function that supplies the speeds of the left and right sides of the robot
073   *     drive.
074   * @param leftController The PIDController for the left side of the robot drive.
075   * @param rightController The PIDController for the right side of the robot drive.
076   * @param outputVolts A function that consumes the computed left and right outputs (in volts) for
077   *     the robot drive.
078   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
079   * @deprecated Use LTVUnicycleController instead.
080   */
081  @Deprecated(since = "2025", forRemoval = true)
082  @SuppressWarnings("this-escape")
083  public RamseteCommand(
084      Trajectory trajectory,
085      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
086      RamseteController controller,
087      SimpleMotorFeedforward feedforward,
088      DifferentialDriveKinematics kinematics,
089      Supplier<DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds> wheelSpeeds,
090      PIDController leftController,
091      PIDController rightController,
092      BiConsumer<Double, Double> outputVolts,
093      Subsystem... requirements) {
094    m_trajectory = requireNonNullParam(trajectory, "trajectory", "RamseteCommand");
095    m_pose = requireNonNullParam(pose, "pose", "RamseteCommand");
096    m_follower = requireNonNullParam(controller, "controller", "RamseteCommand");
097    m_feedforward = feedforward;
098    m_kinematics = requireNonNullParam(kinematics, "kinematics", "RamseteCommand");
099    m_speeds = requireNonNullParam(wheelSpeeds, "wheelSpeeds", "RamseteCommand");
100    m_leftController = requireNonNullParam(leftController, "leftController", "RamseteCommand");
101    m_rightController = requireNonNullParam(rightController, "rightController", "RamseteCommand");
102    m_output = requireNonNullParam(outputVolts, "outputVolts", "RamseteCommand");
103
104    m_usePID = true;
105
106    addRequirements(requirements);
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Constructs a new RamseteCommand that, when executed, will follow the provided trajectory.
111   * Performs no PID control and calculates no feedforwards; outputs are the raw wheel speeds from
112   * the RAMSETE controller, and will need to be converted into a usable form by the user.
113   *
114   * @param trajectory The trajectory to follow.
115   * @param pose A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to
116   *     provide this.
117   * @param follower The RAMSETE follower used to follow the trajectory.
118   * @param kinematics The kinematics for the robot drivetrain.
119   * @param outputMetersPerSecond A function that consumes the computed left and right wheel speeds.
120   * @param requirements The subsystems to require.
121   * @deprecated Use LTVUnicycleController instead.
122   */
123  @Deprecated(since = "2025", forRemoval = true)
124  @SuppressWarnings("this-escape")
125  public RamseteCommand(
126      Trajectory trajectory,
127      Supplier<Pose2d> pose,
128      RamseteController follower,
129      DifferentialDriveKinematics kinematics,
130      BiConsumer<Double, Double> outputMetersPerSecond,
131      Subsystem... requirements) {
132    m_trajectory = requireNonNullParam(trajectory, "trajectory", "RamseteCommand");
133    m_pose = requireNonNullParam(pose, "pose", "RamseteCommand");
134    m_follower = requireNonNullParam(follower, "follower", "RamseteCommand");
135    m_kinematics = requireNonNullParam(kinematics, "kinematics", "RamseteCommand");
136    m_output =
137        requireNonNullParam(outputMetersPerSecond, "outputMetersPerSecond", "RamseteCommand");
138
139    m_feedforward = null;
140    m_speeds = null;
141    m_leftController = null;
142    m_rightController = null;
143
144    m_usePID = false;
145
146    addRequirements(requirements);
147  }
148
149  @Override
150  public void initialize() {
151    m_prevTime = -1;
152    var initialState = m_trajectory.sample(0);
153    m_prevSpeeds =
154        m_kinematics.toWheelSpeeds(
155            new ChassisSpeeds(
156                initialState.velocityMetersPerSecond,
157                0,
158                initialState.curvatureRadPerMeter * initialState.velocityMetersPerSecond));
159    m_prevLeftSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(m_prevSpeeds.leftMetersPerSecond);
160    m_prevRightSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(m_prevSpeeds.rightMetersPerSecond);
161    m_timer.restart();
162    if (m_usePID) {
163      m_leftController.reset();
164      m_rightController.reset();
165    }
166  }
167
168  @Override
169  public void execute() {
170    double curTime = m_timer.get();
171
172    if (m_prevTime < 0) {
173      m_output.accept(0.0, 0.0);
174      m_prevTime = curTime;
175      return;
176    }
177
178    var targetWheelSpeeds =
179        m_kinematics.toWheelSpeeds(
180            m_follower.calculate(m_pose.get(), m_trajectory.sample(curTime)));
181
182    var leftSpeedSetpoint = targetWheelSpeeds.leftMetersPerSecond;
183    var rightSpeedSetpoint = targetWheelSpeeds.rightMetersPerSecond;
184
185    m_leftSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(targetWheelSpeeds.leftMetersPerSecond);
186    m_rightSpeedSetpoint.mut_setMagnitude(targetWheelSpeeds.rightMetersPerSecond);
187
188    double leftOutput;
189    double rightOutput;
190
191    if (m_usePID) {
192      double leftFeedforward =
193          m_feedforward.calculate(m_prevLeftSpeedSetpoint, m_leftSpeedSetpoint).in(Volts);
194
195      double rightFeedforward =
196          m_feedforward.calculate(m_prevRightSpeedSetpoint, m_rightSpeedSetpoint).in(Volts);
197
198      leftOutput =
199          leftFeedforward
200              + m_leftController.calculate(m_speeds.get().leftMetersPerSecond, leftSpeedSetpoint);
201
202      rightOutput =
203          rightFeedforward
204              + m_rightController.calculate(
205                  m_speeds.get().rightMetersPerSecond, rightSpeedSetpoint);
206    } else {
207      leftOutput = leftSpeedSetpoint;
208      rightOutput = rightSpeedSetpoint;
209    }
210
211    m_output.accept(leftOutput, rightOutput);
212    m_prevSpeeds = targetWheelSpeeds;
213    m_prevTime = curTime;
214  }
215
216  @Override
217  public void end(boolean interrupted) {
218    m_timer.stop();
219
220    if (interrupted) {
221      m_output.accept(0.0, 0.0);
222    }
223  }
224
225  @Override
226  public boolean isFinished() {
227    return m_timer.hasElapsed(m_trajectory.getTotalTimeSeconds());
228  }
229
230  @Override
231  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
232    super.initSendable(builder);
233    builder.addDoubleProperty("leftVelocity", () -> m_prevSpeeds.leftMetersPerSecond, null);
234    builder.addDoubleProperty("rightVelocity", () -> m_prevSpeeds.rightMetersPerSecond, null);
235  }
236}
